alert.note: Alert for Perry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Perry, east central Hancock and northwestern Breckinridge Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 247 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hawesville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Perry, east central Hancock and northwestern Breckinridge Counties, including the following locations... Mystic, Skillman, Derby, Sample, Gerald, Dodd, Tobinsport, Clifton Mills, Holt and Ammons. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
